summary: The Hidden Fee Disclosure Act of 2025 aims to amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA). It clarifies and strengthens disclosure requirements for employer-sponsored health plans. Key provisions include expanding the definition of "services" subject to disclosure, outlining specific disclosures related to pharmacy benefit management (PBM) services and third-party administration (TPA) services, particularly regarding compensation and financial arrangements. The bill also includes privacy requirements and mandates that the Secretary of Labor create implementing regulations within a year of enactment with an effective date of January 1, 2026 for new or renewed contracts.
